text: Ha! You legit guessed part of the headline we're using on the podcast when we talk about this.
author: oallenprice

text: It varies widely. Sometimes a day, sometimes six months. On average reporters usually spend 2-4 days researching and conducting interviews.
author: oallenprice

text: Walk into the Fillmore, one of S.F.'s most beloved music venue's, and you're greeted by a bucket of free apples. Why? #BayCurious
author: oallenprice

text: One of the other podcasts at KQED set up themselves so they can be in a flash briefing. I haven’t played with any smartspeakers yet, but I really need to.
author: oallenprice

text: You are too kind.  And agree on Spotify sentiment.
author: oallenprice

text: The town of Hillsborough is suing the owner of the Flintstone House for adding dinosaurs to the landscaping.
author: oallenprice

text: Ah, so you're hearing our radio segments, as opposed to the longer podcast segments?
author: oallenprice

text: Yes. It is. Partly because Twitter only allows for 4 answers, and I chose options that reflect the largest chunk of our listenership. Are you on Android? What do you like there?
author: oallenprice

text: Spotify is of particular interest to me in asking this question. Loads of younger people already there. Maybe discovering podcasts for the first time?
author: oallenprice

text: It's from a music library we subscribe to and is called "Apple Blossom." Might be similar to something more familiar tho, which is why you can't quite place it. ;)
author: oallenprice

text: Just curious: Where do you listen to podcasts? And why that particular app?
author: oallenprice
